intro: Rhynchospora corniculata subsp. amazonica, commonly known as the Amazonian beak-rush, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Cyperaceae family, which includes sedges and other grass-like plants. The plant is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and small, clustered flowering heads. It typically grows in wetland or swampy habitats, thriving in moist, nutrient-rich soils. Its ecological role includes providing habitat and food for various insect and bird species.
